citation.article-title: Sporomusa termitida sp. nov., an H2/CO2-utilizing acetogen isolated from termites.

p.s: Description of Sporomusa termitida sp. nov.

Sporomusa termitida (ter.mi'ti.da. L. n. tarmes, tarmit-(L.L. var. termes, termit-) worm that eats wood; M.L. adj. termitida referring to termites, from whose intestinal tract the organism was isolated)
Straight to slightly curved rods, 0.5-0.8 x 2-8 μm in size, occurring singly, in pairs, or short chains.
Gram-negative by staining and cell wall ultrastructure.
Heat-resistant endospores formed, b-type cytochrome(s) present.

Ferments H2 + CO2, CO, formate, methanol, ethanol, betaine, sarcosine, lactate, pyruvate, citrate, malonate, mannitol, and 3,4,5-trimethoxybenzoate yielding acetate as the major or sole fermentation product.
Ferments succinate to propionate as the major organic end product.
Simple sugars and sugar alcohols are generally not fermented.
Yeast extract and/or a source of amino acids required for good growth.
DNA base composition: 48.6 mol% G + C (strain JSN-2; buoyant density).
Source: Gut contents of the termite Nasutitermes nigriceps.
Type strain: JSN-2, DSM4440, deposited in the Deutsche Sammlung von Microorganismen, Göttingen.
